course_description: Examines the post-1800 development of industrial America. Topics covered include the rise of manufacturing, banking, the labor movement, agriculture, and foreign trade. Special attention is paid to the role of the government sector in the economy.
prerequisites: ECON 101 or ECON_OX 101 or FIN 201 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3375, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 1-2:15p, Instructor: M. Jones, Status: Open
